---

# WK Kellogg Co (K) - Comprehensive Analysis Report

## 1. Company Overview

WK Kellogg Co operates as a food company in the United States, Canada, Mexico, and the Caribbean. The company manufactures, markets, and distributes ready-to-eat cereal products primarily under the Frosted Flakes, Special K, Froot Loops, Raisin Bran, Frosted Mini-Wheats, Kashi, Corn Flakes, and Apple Jacks brand names. On October 2, 2023, the Spin-Off was completed through Kellanova's distribution of one share of WK Kellogg Co common stock for every four shares of Kellanova common stock to Kellanova's share owners. On October 2, 2023, WK Kellogg Co began "regular-way" trading as an independent publicly traded company under the stock symbol "KLG" on the New York Stock Exchange.

Our journey began in 1894, when our founder W.K. Kellogg reimagined the future of food with the creation of Corn Flakes, changing breakfast forever. Our iconic brand portfolio includes Kellogg's Frosted Flakes®, Rice Krispies®, Froot Loops®, Kashi®, Special K®, Kellogg's Raisin Bran®, and Bear Naked®. With a presence in the majority of households across North America, our brands play a key role in enhancing the lives of millions of consumers every day, promoting a strong sense of physical, emotional and societal wellbeing.

## 2. Current Market Data

**Important Note: WK Kellogg Co (KLG) has been acquired and is no longer publicly traded.**

WK Kellogg Co is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Ferrero. The transaction was previously announced on July 10, 2025, and approved by WK Kellogg Co shareowners on September 19, 2025. With the completion of the transaction, WK Kellogg Co shareowners are entitled to receive $23.00 in cash for each share of WK Kellogg Co common stock they owned immediately prior to the closing. WK Kellogg Co has ceased trading and will no longer be listed on the New York Stock Exchange.

The ticker "K" now refers to Kellanova, which Mars completed its acquisition of on December 11, 2025 at $83.50 per share in cash.

## 3. Existing Products/Services

WK Kellogg Co's iconic brands including Kellogg's Frosted Flakes®, Kellogg's Froot Loops®, Kellogg's Frosted Mini Wheats®, Kellogg's Special K®, Kellogg's Rice Krispies®, Kellogg's Raisin Bran®, Kashi®, Bear Naked® formed the core product portfolio.

Key product categories included:
• **Breakfast Cereals**: Traditional ready-to-eat cereals across multiple flavors and nutritional profiles
• **Healthy Options**: Kashi and Bear Naked brands targeting health-conscious consumers
• **Licensed Characters**: Beloved brand characters, including Tony the Tiger® and Toucan Sam®

The company serves supermarket chains, wholesalers, supercenters, club stores, mass merchandisers, distributors, convenience stores, drug stores, gasoline stations, value stores, online channels, and other retail food outlets through its own sales forces, broker, and distributor arrangements.

## 4. Planned Products/Services/Projects

Research to support and expand the use of existing products and to develop new food products is performed in Battle Creek, Michigan, including at the W. K. Kellogg Institute for Food and Nutrition Research. The company's expenditures for research and development were approximately $24 million for the year ended December 28, 2024.

Under Ferrero ownership, rumours are circling about brand collaborations. While Ferrero comes from a confectionery background, bets are on for healthier mash-ups – at least to begin with. Nutella-flavoured cereals are possible, but with health trends on the rise, it may be more likely that cereal-inspired flavours find their way into Ferrero's snacks and sweets.

## 5. Growth Strategy

The acquisition supports Ferrero's portfolio expansion and growth in North America by adding WK Kellogg Co's highly complementary, iconic cereal brands, serving consumers across more occasions throughout the day. The acquisition expands Ferrero's reach across more consumption occasions with renowned brands.

The acquisition represents the "next chapter" in Ferrero's strategy to acquire, invest in and grow iconic brands in North America. Ferrero plans to invest in and grow WK Kellogg Co's iconic portfolio of brands across the United States, Canada and the Caribbean.

## 6. Current and Potential Major Clients

The company primarily serves retail channels including:
• Supermarket chains
• Wholesale distributors  
• Mass merchandisers and supercenters
• Club stores
• Convenience stores and drug stores
• Online retail platforms

With a presence in the majority of households across North America, brands play a key role in enhancing the lives of millions of consumers every day, indicating broad consumer penetration.

## 7. Financial Data & Performance

**2024 Full Year Results:**
In 2024, WK Kellogg Co's revenue was $2.71 billion, a decrease of -1.99% compared to the previous year's $2.76 billion. Earnings were $72.00 million, a decrease of -34.55%.

**Q2 2025 Preliminary Results:**
For the second quarter ended June 28, 2025, the company expects net sales to be in the range of $610 million to $615 million and adjusted EBITDA to be in the range of $43 million to $48 million.

**Employee Count:**
On December 28, 2024, the company had approximately 3,280 employees.

**Dividend Policy:**
WK Kellogg Co announced a 3% increase in its quarterly dividend, raising it from $0.16 to $0.165 per share, payable on March 14, 2025.

## 8. Headwinds & Tailwinds

**Headwinds:**
• Many American consumers have shunned sugary cereals in favor of breakfast options considered healthier, and other shoppers moved to private label brands after inflation spiked in recent years.
• Soft demand for packaged breakfast cereal amid macroeconomic uncertainty
• Since The Kellogg Company split in two – Kellanova and WK Kellogg Co – the latter has been struggling. At the time of the acquisition announcement, the company was carrying half a billion dollars of debt.

**Tailwinds:**
• Strong brand recognition and household penetration
• Ferrero's 75 years of heritage and experience in brand building
• The business will continue to operate out of Battle Creek, Michigan, maintaining operational continuity
• Access to Ferrero's global distribution network and resources

## 9. Market Shares

Specific market share data was not available in the sources reviewed. However, the company maintains "a presence in the majority of households across North America", suggesting significant market penetration in the North American cereal market.

## 10. Comparison to Competitors

The company competes in the broader breakfast cereal market against companies like General Mills and Post Holdings. WK Kellogg spun off into a standalone company in 2023 as Kellogg sought to focus more on its growing snack business and divest from the sleepy cereal category. Kellogg renamed itself to Kellanova, which now houses snack brands such as Pringles and Cheez-It.

## 11. Partnerships, Mergers and Acquisitions

**Major M&A Activity:**

• **Ferrero Acquisition Completed**: Ferrero agreed to acquire WK Kellogg Co for $23.00 per share in cash, representing a total enterprise value of $3.1 billion. The transaction was completed on September 26, 2025, after being announced on July 10, 2025, and approved by shareowners on September 19, 2025.

• **Strategic Rationale**: The move deepens Ferrero's ambitions in the U.S. market. The Italian family-owned company has been on a North American buying spree in recent years. "Today's news is a key milestone in that journey, giving us confidence in the opportunities ahead."

## 12. Recent Developments

**September 26, 2025**: The Ferrero Group announced the successful completion of its acquisition of WK Kellogg Co

**July 2024**: The Board of Directors approved a reorganization plan in connection with the Company's strategic priority to modernize its supply chain. Under this restructuring plan, the Company will consolidate its manufacturing network by closing its Omaha, Nebraska plant, with a phased reduction in production beginning in late 2025 and full closure targeted by the end of 2026.

**Corporate Changes**: ACM Research will be added to the S&P SmallCap 600 index as WK Kellogg is being removed due to its pending acquisition by The Ferrero Group. The change will be implemented once the Ferrero Group's acquisition of WK Kellogg closes.

## 13. AI Investment Rating & Fair Value Assessment

**Investment Status**: **NOT APPLICABLE - COMPANY ACQUIRED**

WK Kellogg Co is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Ferrero. Shareholders received $23.00 in cash for each share of common stock, and the company has ceased trading and is no longer listed on the New York Stock Exchange.

**Historical Context**: The Ferrero acquisition at $23.00 per share represented a 40% premium to 30-day volume weighted average trading price at announcement, suggesting the market viewed this as a favorable exit for shareholders given the company's operational challenges in the declining cereal category.

**Final Acquisition Value**: $3.1 billion total enterprise value to Ferrero in September 2025.

**Note**: For investors interested in cereal/food exposure, the original Kellogg company's snacking business now trades as Kellanova, which was acquired by Mars in December 2025 for $83.50 per share.
tldr_summary:
WK Kellogg Co was a North American food company specializing in breakfast cereals and healthy food brands like Frosted Flakes, Special K, and Kashi, operating across the United States, Canada, and Mexico. The company was recently acquired by Ferrero for $3.1 billion in September 2025, with shareholders receiving $23.00 per share in cash.

Key highlights include a strategic pivot following a corporate split, declining cereal market performance, and successful acquisition by Ferrero. The company struggled with changing consumer preferences toward healthier breakfast options and private label brands. Ferrero's acquisition represents an expansion strategy to enter the North American market, leveraging WK Kellogg's iconic brand portfolio and established distribution networks.

Investment Rating: Not Applicable - Company has been fully acquired and is no longer publicly traded, with shareholders having received a 40% premium over previous trading prices.
